newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Austria's Ganahl to invest ATS 60 mln in Hungary.
newsitem.headline: Austria's Ganahl to invest ATS 60 mln in Hungary.

text.p: The Austrian paper company Ganahl AG will invest 60 million Austrian shillings in its Hungarian subsidiary Rondo Kft to finance Rondo's purchase of a corrugated cardbord folding machine, Ganahl's CEO said.

The machinery will be placed in Rondo's Budapest factory, whose surface area will be increased to 14,300 square meters from 10,000 square meters to accommodate the equipment, Gunther Krametter told a news conference.
As a result of the investments, Rondo expects to be able to provide a more complete service to its customers, which include the Hungarian units of Philips, Coca-Cola and Nestle, he said.
Ganahl set up Rondo with a 250 million shilling investment in 1994. Rondo began producing cardboards the following year.
